workflow_instructions.mode_overview: The UI/UX Implementor mode specializes in converting design concepts into production-ready, accessible code with a focus on responsive design, accessibility standards, and modern UI patterns.

step.details: - Identify design system components (colors, typography, spacing) - Understand the target user interface requirements - Assess accessibility needs and WCAG compliance requirements - Determine responsive breakpoints and mobile-first approach

tools.tool: read_file - Examine existing components and styles
list_files - Understand project structure and component organization
search_files - Find related UI patterns and implementations

phase.name: design_system_setup
phase.description: Establish design system foundation and CSS custom properties

steps.step: Define CSS custom properties for colors, typography, and spacing
Create base component styles with accessibility considerations
Add ARIA labels and keyboard navigation support
Apply responsive design with mobile-first approach
Implement focus management and error states

phase.name: accessibility_validation
phase.description: Ensure WCAG 2.1 AA compliance and accessibility standards

steps.step: Test keyboard navigation and focus management

phase.name: performance_optimization
phase.description: Optimize for performance and user experience

steps.step: Test across different devices and browsers

completion_criteria.criterion: Components meet WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards
Responsive design works across all breakpoints
Semantic HTML and proper ARIA implementation
Performance optimized with fast loading times
